title: Shibden Park Walking Route

images.title: Tim Marchant / Shibden Park
images.caption: Shibden Park. The boating lake, picnic area and miniature railway.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Top entrance to dry stone wall exhibition, Shibden Park, Southowram, Halifax
images.caption: Top entrance to dry stone wall exhibition. The conical pillars were inspired by mountain cairns, and show off the skill of the waller.

images.title: The miniature railway, Shibden Park, Northowram by Humphrey Bolton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The miniature railway

images.title: Flood plain of Red Beck, Shibden Park, Northowram by Humphrey Bolton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Flood plain of Red Beck

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Shibden Park Lake, Southowram, Halifax
images.caption: A family walks on the surfaced path running along the lake. Frequented by ducks and rowing boats.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Wooded valley in Shibden Park, Southowram, Halifax
images.caption: Wooded valley. Most of these plants are water dock, from which dock pudding is made.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Sheep pound in dry stone wall exhibition, Shibden Park, Southowram, Halifax
images.caption: Sheep pound in dry stone wall exhibition. Just to make this more difficult to build, it was sited on sloping ground.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Pond in Shibden Hall garden, Southowram, Halifax
images.caption: Pond in Shibden Hall garden, Southowram, Halifax. The style of the fences suggests that this was intended as a 'Chinese' garden.

description: This delightful country park in Halifax is the perfect place for a peaceful afternoon stroll. The park includes a Wilderness Garden, cascades and pools, woodland and a fruit garden with a collection of heritage fruit trees. The centrepiece of the park is the Mere, where you can hire a rowing boat or just stroll along the shore. You can also visit Shibden Hall -  a Grade II listed timber framed hall with a history dating back back to 1420.  Park facilities include a popular cafe and visitor centre. The circular Shibden Valley Walk also starts from the car park. The trail explores the lovely countryside and hills of Shibden Dale, to the north of the park. It's a good way of further stretching your legs if you have time.
